Alaykin,‘to testify his fidelity to the Spa- niardS‚ and to clear himself from some suspi- cions that were entertained against him, went out against Oaherkaikin, and by threats or pro- mises obliged him to give up the captives taken in the woods where Lisondo and the other St. Iagans had been lately slain. After a sort of friendship had been simulated‚ rather than con- tracted between Ychoalay and Alaykin‚ our townsmen went to assist the Abipones of St. Jeronymo in two expeditions against Debaya- kaikin‚ from which, however, they derived more loss than advantage.
